conversation.content:
You are playing a text adventure game on a damaged space station.
Your goal: activate the bridge console to send a distress signal.

You have tools available to explore and interact with the world:
- look: examine your surroundings
- go: move in a direction (north, south, east, west)
- take: pick up an item
- use: use an item from your inventory
- read: read an item you are carrying
- inventory: check what you are carrying

Use the tools to explore the station, find items, and solve puzzles.
If you are stuck, respond with: GIVE_UP

Game started. You are in the airlock.

You are in the station's airlock. Emergency lights pulse red. The outer hatch is sealed shut — vacuum on the other side. A door leads into the corridor to the north.
You are in the station's airlock. Emergency lights pulse red. The outer hatch is sealed shut — vacuum on the other side. A door leads into the corridor to the north.

You are in the station's airlock. Emergency lights pulse red. The outer hatch is sealed shut — vacuum on the other side. A door leads into the corridor to the north. I should probably head north into the corridor.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

I should probably head to the bridge to send a distress signal.

You enter the Bridge.

The bridge is silent. A large console dominates the center of the room. Its screen is dark — it looks like it needs a keycard to activate. The corridor is to the south.

You enter the Bridge.

The bridge is silent. A large console dominates the center of the room. Its screen is dark — it looks like it needs a keycard to activate. The corridor is to the south.

I need a keycard to activate the console. I should probably go back to the corridor and check the other rooms.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

I'll try the med bay first.

You enter the Med Bay.

A small medical bay with overturned supply carts. A crew log sits on the counter — it might have useful information. The corridor is to the east.

You enter the Med Bay.

A small medical bay with overturned supply carts. A crew log sits on the counter — it might have useful information. The corridor is to the east.

I should take the crew log and read it.
You pick up the crew log.
You pick up the crew log.

You read the crew log:

CREW LOG - Day 247: Power failure hit deck 3. Captain stashed the emergency keycard in the engine room before the lights went out. Grab a flashlight if you head in there — it's pitch black.

You read the crew log:

CREW LOG - Day 247: Power failure hit deck 3. Captain stashed the emergency keycard in the engine room before the lights went out. Grab a flashlight if you head in there — it's pitch black.

Okay, so the keycard is in the engine room, and I'll need a flashlight. I should go back to the corridor and then to the engine room.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

Now to the engine room.

You enter the Engine Room.

The engine room is pitch black. You can barely see anything. You hear the hum of dormant machinery. Near the entrance, you feel something on a shelf — it might be a flashlight. The corridor is back to the west.

You enter the Engine Room.

The engine room is pitch black. You can barely see anything. You hear the hum of dormant machinery. Near the entrance, you feel something on a shelf — it might be a flashlight. The corridor is back to the west.

I need to take the flashlight.
You pick up the flashlight.

You pick up the flashlight.

Now that I have the flashlight, I should use it.
You switch on the flashlight. The beam cuts through the darkness. You can see the engine core now — and something glinting under a pile of debris near the wall. It looks like a keycard.

You switch on the flashlight. The beam cuts through the darkness. You can see the engine core now — and something glinting under a pile of debris near the wall. It looks like a keycard.

I found the keycard! I should take it.
You pick up the keycard.

You pick up the keycard.

Now that I have the keycard, I can go back to the bridge and activate the console.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

You enter the Corridor.

A long metal corridor stretches before you. Sparks drip from damaged ceiling panels. Doors lead to the bridge (north), engine room (east), and med bay (west). The airlock is to the south.

Now to the bridge.

You enter the Bridge.

The bridge is silent. A large console dominates the center of the room. Its screen is dark — it looks like it needs a keycard to activate. The corridor is to the south.

You enter the Bridge.

The bridge is silent. A large console dominates the center of the room. Its screen is dark — it looks like it needs a keycard to activate. The corridor is to the south.

I have the keycard, so I should use it on the console.

You slide the keycard into the console. Screens flicker to life. The station's distress beacon activates — a rescue signal pulses out into deep space.

*** YOU WIN ***
Completed in 16 moves.
